result.execSummary:
The defendant Frederman Herrera Moreno was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: - CASH BOND APPLIED leaving a balance of $313.00. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan.
- CASH BOND APPLIED leaving a balance of $129.00. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan.
- Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

records.addlTxt:
11:04 AM Defendant Frederman Herrera Moreno in court.  Attorney Robert C Howard Iii in court for Frederman Herrera Moreno.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter Enrique Soria in court. Court calls 2022CM19 & 2022TR62. Interpreter sworn. ADA recites agreement - upon plea to count 2 will recommend a fine, costs and DNA sample and count 1 will be dismissed and read-in and 2022TR62 will be dismissed. Atty Howard concurs. Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty on count 2 as charged and orders count 1 be dismissed and read-in. Court orders 2022TR62 be dismissed. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Sentencing statement by ADA. Sentencing statement by Atty Howard. No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-150 fine plus costs. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Court adjourned at 11:12 AM

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant Frederman Herrera Moreno in court.  Attorney Robert C Howard Iii in court for Frederman Herrera Moreno.  Attorney Gerise Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court advises that we do not have an interpreter today. Court sets for plea & sentencing on July 26, 2022 at 11:00 AM
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:59 AM Defendant Frederman Herrera Moreno appeared in court, Attorney Gerise Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin and County of Green Lake, Interpreter Enrique Soria appeared in court - previously sworn. Court also calls 2022TR62. Defendant has not received a copy of the criminal complaint. Court reads the complaint to the defendant. Deputy handed the defendant a copy of the criminal complaint. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court finds probable cause. Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney. Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY. Statement by defendant, if given the opportunity, will get an attorney. Court determines the defendant stands mute and enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant. DA makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $200 cash bond and conditions of: Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Court will set for Status of counsel on March 22, 2022 at 11:30 AM. Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY to the TR citations.

Court adjourned at 12:06 PM
